title: Look at Degrees of Numerator and Denominator
text: The horizontal asymptote of a rational function can be determined by looking at the degrees of the numerator and denominator. Note that a horizontal asymptote is of form $$y=c$$, where c is a constant in real numbers.

title: No Horizontal Asymptote
text: Recall that when the degree of numerator is greater than degree of denominator by one there is no horizontal asymptote but there is a slant asymptote.

title: Horizontal Asymptote at Ratio of Leading Coefficients
text: Recall that when the degree of numerator is equal to degree of denominator, horizontal asymptote at ratio of leading coefficients.
